newsitem.title: LATVIA: BOURSE SAYS READY TO LAUNCH ITS FREE LIST.
newsitem.headline: BOURSE SAYS READY TO LAUNCH ITS FREE LIST.

text.p: The Riga stock exchange on Friday said it is ready to launch its free list, following the security commission's approval on Thursday.
"We have set no deadlines but we will be ready to do that in the coming weeks," Uldis Cerps, president of the bourse, told a news conference.
The free list will be available for any company whose share issue prospectus has been approved by the securities commission, Cerps said.
Quoted companies which view the information and disclosure requirements of the other lists as too demanding could also be transferred to the free list, he said.
"Young, growing companies trying to attract public funds could seek them via the bourse's free list," Cerps said.
Cerps said the Riga bourse thus joins the tradition of most bigger European stock exchanges, which also operate free lists.

"We will have lists ready by the end of June and we already have one secondary list company, Kurzeme Lock, which has applied for the free list quotation," Guntar Kokarevich, the bourse's finance department manager, said.
The bourse said that it might transfer secondary list stocks Akta, Liepaja and Ventspils fish canneries, Naruta confectionery and Rota1 to the free list.
The bourse warned the companies on Thursday that their quotation will be stopped from May 26 unless they submit the mandatory financial reports by today, Friday.
By mid-day only Naruta confectionery had handed in its balance sheet to the bourse, Kokarevich said.
